intro: Laserpitium gaveanum, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, high-altitude environments. It produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette. Laserpitium gaveanum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
